revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=April 2010}} {{Infobox person | name = | image = Caroline Rhea1.jpg | caption = Rhea in 2012 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1964|04|13}} | birth_place = [[Westmount, Quebec]], Canada | occupation = Comedian, actress, voice actress | years_active = 1986–present | partner = [[Costaki Economopoulos]] (2007-2010) | children = 1 | alma_mater = [[Dalhousie University]]
[[University of Arizona]] }} '''Caroline Rhea''' (born April 13, 1964) is a Canadian [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]] and [[actress]] who is best known for her role as [[Hilda Spellman]] on the ABC show ''[[Sabrina the Teenage Witch (1996 TV series)|Sabrina the Teenage Witch]]''. She has performed numerous comedy specials, including three one-hour standup specials for HBO, Showtime, and Bravo. She is also known as the voice of Linda Flynn-Fletcher on the [[Disney Channel]] series ''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'' and as a regular on ''[[Hollywood Squares]]'' with her friend [[Whoopi Goldberg]]. Rhea was chosen by [[Rosie O'Donnell]] as the new [[Television presenter|hostess]] of her syndicated talk show, renamed ''[[The Caroline Rhea Show]]'' and hosted the [[reality television]] show ''[[The Biggest Loser (U.S. TV series)|The Biggest Loser]]'' on [[NBC]] for the first three seasons. She appears regularly on ABC's ''[[Match Game]]'' with [[Alec Baldwin]] and is reprising her roles as Eugenia Scrimmage in the ''[[Macdonald Hall|Bruno & Boots]]'' movie franchise and Noleta Nethercott in ''A Very Sordid Wedding''. ==Early life== Rhea was born and raised in [[Westmount, Quebec]], the daughter of Margery, and David Rhea, an [[obstetrician]] and [[gynecologist]].{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/31/Caroline-Rhea.html |title=Caroline Rhea Biography (1964-) |publisher=Filmreference.com |date= |accessdate=2012-04-23}} She has two sisters, Cynthia and Celia. She attended [[The Study]], an all-girls private school in [[Westmount, Quebec|Westmount]], Quebec; [[Dalhousie University]] in Nova Scotia;{{cite news |title=Laughing matters: Comedian recalls days at Dal as she gets ready for Ha!ifax Comedy Festival |author=Stephen Cooke |url=http://thechronicleherald.ca/ArtsLife/1178359.html | archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20100424060513/http://thechronicleherald.ca/ArtsLife/1178359.html | archivedate =2010-04-24 |newspaper=Chronicle Herald |date=April 21, 2010 |accessdate=}} and the [[University of Arizona]]. ==Career== === Standup === Rhea moved to New York in 1986 to pursue a career as a comedian and actress. She began performing at venues like [[Catch a Rising Star (comedy clubs)|Catch a Rising Star]] and The [[Comic Strip Live|Comic Strip]], where she performed along with comedians including [[Chris Rock]], [[Louis C.K.]], [[Dave Attell]], [[Marc Maron]], and [[Jim Gaffigan]]. Rhea made her first filmed standup appearances on ''MTV's Half-Hour Comedy Hour'', ''Comic Strip Live'' and ''Caroline's Comedy Hour''. Rhea was given a one-hour special for [[HBO]], called ''One Night Stand''. She followed this up with ''Rhea's'' ''Anatomy'', her one-hour special for [[Bravo (U.S. TV network)|Bravo]], and ''Give Me My Remote'' for [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]]. === Film and television === After finding success in New York as a comedian, Caroline moved to [[Los Angeles]] to pursue an acting career in [[Hollywood]], debuting on [[NBC]]'s television series ''[[Pride & Joy (TV series)|Pride & Joy]],'' where she co-starred with [[Jeremy Piven]]. She later gained widespread fame for her role as Aunt Hilda on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] (and later, [[The WB Television Network|The WB]] network) television show, ''[[Sabrina the Teenage Witch (1996 TV series)|Sabrina the Teenage Witch]]'', and for her recurring role on the latest incarnation of ''[[Hollywood Squares]]''. Rhea is also well known for her role as Linda Flynn-Fletcher on the long-running Disney show ''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'', for her [[broadcast syndication|syndicated]] daytime [[talk show]], ''[[The Caroline Rhea Show]],'' as the original host of ''[[The Biggest Loser (U.S. TV series)|The Biggest Loser]]'' on NBC, and for playing Noleta Nethercott on the TV series ''[[Sordid Lives: The Series]]'' for Logo, which has recently been rebooted as a feature called ''A Very Sordid Wedding'', which premiered in March 2017 in Palm Springs. In 2004, she appeared in the cult-classics Disney's ''[[Mom's Got a Date with a Vampire]]'' and in ''[[Christmas with the Kranks]].'' In 2005, Rhea appeared in ''[[The Perfect Man]]'', playing a co-worker of Jean ([[Heather Locklear]]) and had a recurring role on the hit [[Disney Channel Original Series]], ''[[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]]'' as Ilsa Shickelgubermeiger-Von Helsing der Keppelugerhofer, an inspector turned manager of the rival hotel. In 2007, she starred in the original [[Lifetime Television]] movie ''[[To Be Fat Like Me]]'' opposite [[Kaley Cuoco]] and in the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] animated series ''Two Dreadful Children''. In 2008, Rhea starred alongside [[Justin Guarini]] and [[Mircea Monroe]] in the [[MarVista Entertainment]] production of ''Fast Girl''. In 2013, Rhea hosted a travelling live stage show version of the game show ''[[Family Feud]]'' which toured fairs in the US and Canada, including the [[Calgary Stampede]]. In 2017, she has had a recurring role on ABC's revival of ''[[Match Game]]''.[http://www.arkansasonline.com/news/2018/jun/22/north-little-rock-woman-wins-10000-abcs-match-game/ "North Little Rock woman wins $10,000 on ABC's 'Match Game'"] ''Arkansas Online''. Retrieved 2018-07-15. Rhea has competed on Bravo's ''[[Celebrity Poker Showdown]]'' and [[Game Show Network|GSN]]'s ''World Series of Blackjack,'' and also done a live webcast with author, Meg Cabot. In 2018, Rhea began hosting ''Caroline & Friends'' on GSN. The series features funny videos of animals and children. The studio audience votes for the best video chosen by Rhea and her two guest comedian co-hosts.{{cite web |url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/article/Game-Show-Networks-Comedic-Family-Submitted-Video-Show-CAROLINE-AND-FRIENDS-20180531 |title=Game Show Network's Comedic Family-Submitted Video Show Caroline and Friends |publisher=broadwayworld.com |access-date=July 16, 2018}} === Charity work === {{unsourced section|date=May 2017}} Rhea has appeared at ''[[Comic Relief (charity)|Comic Relief]]'' as well as the [[Ms. Foundation]]'s "Women of Comedy from Caroline's Comedy Club". She appeared as a contestant in 2001 on a special edition of ''[[Who Wants to Be a Millionaire]]'', winning $125,000 for her charity. ==Personal life== Rhea and her former partner, comedian [[Costaki Economopoulos]], have a daughter Ava Rhea Economopoulos, born October 21, 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20235287,00.html |title=Caroline Rhea Has a Baby Girl! - Babies, Caroline Rhea |publisher=People.com |date=2008-10-23 |accessdate=2012-04-23}}{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/2008/07/20/2008-07-20_caroline_rhea_messes_with_texas_in_the_u.html |title=Caroline Rhea messes with Texas in the uninhibited 'Sordid Lives' |author=Patrick Huguenin |publisher=''[[New York Daily News]]'' |date=2008-07-19 |accessdate=2008-08-07}} == Filmography == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film |- ! Year ! Title !
